Package.name: CFE_SB
Package.shortDescription: NASA Core Flight System Software Bus

IntegerDataType.name: MsgIdValue
IntegerDataType.shortDescription: Underlying value of an abstract MsgId

ContainerDataType.name: MsgId
ContainerDataType.shortDescription: A Software Bus message identifier, used for subscription and routing

Entry.name: Value
Entry.shortDescription: Internal MsgId Value

EnumeratedDataType.name: QosPriority
EnumeratedDataType.shortDescription: Selects the priority level for message routing

EnumeratedDataType.name: QosReliability
EnumeratedDataType.shortDescription: Selects the reliability level for message routing

ContainerDataType.name: Qos
ContainerDataType.LongDescription: Currently an unused parameter in #CFE_SB_SubscribeEx Intended to be used for interprocessor communication only

Entry.name: Priority
Entry.shortDescription: *Specify high(1) or low(0) message priority for off-board routing, currently unused

Entry.name: Reliability
Entry.shortDescription: Specify high(1) or low(0) message transfer reliability for off-board routing, currently unused

ContainerDataType.name: PipeInfoEntry
ContainerDataType.LongDescription:
This statistics structure is output as part of the CFE SB "Send Pipe Info" command (CFE_SB_SEND_PIPE_INFO_CC).
Previous versions of CFE simply wrote the internal CFE_SB_PipeD_t object to the file, but this also contains information such as pointers which are not relevant outside the running CFE process.
By defining the pipe info structure separately, it also provides some independence, such that the internal CFE_SB_PipeD_t definition can evolve without changing the binary format of the information file.

Entry.name: PipeId
Entry.shortDescription: The runtime ID of the pipe

Entry.name: AppId
Entry.shortDescription: The runtime ID of the application that owns the pipe

Entry.name: PipeName
Entry.shortDescription: The Name of the pipe

Entry.name: AppName
Entry.shortDescription: The Name of the application that owns the pipe

Entry.name: MaxQueueDepth
Entry.shortDescription: The allocated depth of the pipe (max capacity)

Entry.name: CurrentQueueDepth
Entry.shortDescription: The current depth of the pipe

Entry.name: PeakQueueDepth
Entry.shortDescription: The peak depth of the pipe (high watermark)

Entry.name: SendErrors
Entry.shortDescription: Number of errors when writing to this pipe

Entry.name: Opts
Entry.shortDescription: Pipe options set (bitmask)

Entry.name: Spare
Entry.shortDescription: Padding to make this structure a multiple of 4 bytes

ContainerDataType.name: WriteFileInfoCmd_Payload
ContainerDataType.LongDescription: This structure contains a generic definition used by three SB commands, 'Write Routing Info to File' #CFE_SB_SEND_ROUTING_INFO_CC, 'Write Pipe Info to File' #CFE_SB_SEND_PIPE_INFO_CC and 'Write Map Info to File' #CFE_SB_SEND_MAP_INFO_CC.

Entry.name: Filename
Entry.shortDescription: Path and Filename of data to be loaded

ContainerDataType.name: RouteCmd_Payload
ContainerDataType.LongDescription: This structure contains a definition used by two SB commands, 'Enable Route' #CFE_SB_ENABLE_ROUTE_CC and 'Disable Route' #CFE_SB_DISABLE_ROUTE_CC. A route is the destination pipe for a particular message and is therefore defined as a MsgId and PipeId combination.

Entry.name: MsgId
Entry.shortDescription: Message ID of route to be enabled or disabled #CFE_SB_MsgId_t

Entry.name: Pipe
Entry.shortDescription: Pipe ID of route to be enabled or disabled #CFE_SB_PipeId_t

Entry.name: CommandCounter
Entry.shortDescription: Count of valid commands received

Entry.name: CommandErrorCounter
Entry.shortDescription: Count of invalid commands received

Entry.name: NoSubscribersCounter
Entry.shortDescription: Count pkts sent with no subscribers

Entry.name: MsgSendErrorCounter
Entry.shortDescription: Count of message send errors

Entry.name: MsgReceiveErrorCounter
Entry.shortDescription: Count of message receive errors

Entry.name: InternalErrorCounter
Entry.shortDescription: Count of queue read or write errors

Entry.name: CreatePipeErrorCounter
Entry.shortDescription: Count of errors in create pipe API

Entry.name: SubscribeErrorCounter
Entry.shortDescription: Count of errors in subscribe API

Entry.name: PipeOptsErrorCounter
Entry.shortDescription: Count of errors in set/get pipe options API

Entry.name: DuplicateSubscriptionsCounter
Entry.shortDescription: Count of duplicate subscriptions

Entry.name: GetPipeIdByNameErrorCounter
Entry.shortDescription: Count of errors in get pipe id by name API

Entry.name: PipeOverflowErrorCounter
Entry.shortDescription: Count of pipe overflow errors

Entry.name: MsgLimitErrorCounter
Entry.shortDescription: Count of msg id to pipe errors

Entry.name: MemPoolHandle
Entry.shortDescription: Handle to Software Bus Memory Pool

Entry.name: MemInUse
Entry.shortDescription: Memory in use

ContainerDataType.name: PipeDepthStats
ContainerDataType.LongDescription: Used in SB Statistics Telemetry Packet #CFE_SB_StatMsg_t

Entry.name: PipeId
Entry.shortDescription: Pipe Id associated with the stats below

Entry.name: MaxQueueDepth
Entry.shortDescription: Number of messages the pipe can hold

Entry.name: CurrentQueueDepth
Entry.shortDescription: Number of messages currently on the pipe

Entry.name: PeakQueueDepth
Entry.shortDescription: Peak number of messages in the pipe

Entry.name: Spare
Entry.shortDescription: Spare word to ensure alignment

ContainerDataType.name: StatsTlm_Payload
ContainerDataType.LongDescription: SB Statistics packet sent (via CFE_SB_SendMsg) in response to #CFE_SB_SEND_SB_STATS_CC

Entry.name: MsgIdsInUse
Entry.shortDescription: Current number of MsgIds with a destination

Entry.name: PeakMsgIdsInUse
Entry.shortDescription: Peak number of MsgIds with a destination

Entry.name: MaxMsgIdsAllowed
Entry.shortDescription: cFE Cfg Param #CFE_PLATFORM_SB_MAX_MSG_IDS

Entry.name: PipesInUse
Entry.shortDescription: Number of pipes currently in use

Entry.name: PeakPipesInUse
Entry.shortDescription: Peak number of pipes since last reboot

Entry.name: MaxPipesAllowed
Entry.shortDescription: cFE Cfg Param #CFE_PLATFORM_SB_MAX_PIPES

Entry.name: MemInUse
Entry.shortDescription: Memory bytes currently in use for SB msg transfers

Entry.name: PeakMemInUse
Entry.shortDescription: Peak memory bytes in use for SB msg transfers

Entry.name: MaxMemAllowed
Entry.shortDescription: cFE Cfg Param #CFE_PLATFORM_SB_BUF_MEMORY_BYTES

Entry.name: SubscriptionsInUse
Entry.shortDescription: Number of current subscriptions

Entry.name: PeakSubscriptionsInUse
Entry.shortDescription: Peak number of subscriptions

Entry.name: SBBuffersInUse
Entry.shortDescription: Number of SB message buffers currently in use

Entry.name: PeakSBBuffersInUse
Entry.shortDescription: Max number of SB message buffers in use

Entry.name: MaxPipeDepthAllowed
Entry.shortDescription: cFE Cfg Param #CFE_PLATFORM_SB_MAX_PIPE_DEPTH

ContainerDataType.name: RoutingFileEntry
ContainerDataType.LongDescription: Structure of one element of the routing information in response to #CFE_SB_SEND_ROUTING_INFO_CC

Entry.name: MsgId
Entry.shortDescription: Message Id portion of the route

Entry.name: PipeId
Entry.shortDescription: Pipe Id portion of the route

Entry.name: State
Entry.shortDescription: Route Enabled or Disabled

Entry.name: MsgCnt
Entry.shortDescription: Number of msgs with this MsgId sent to this PipeId

Entry.name: AppName
Entry.shortDescription: Pipe Depth Statistics

Entry.name: PipeName
Entry.shortDescription: Pipe Depth Statistics

ContainerDataType.name: MsgMapFileEntry
ContainerDataType.LongDescription: Structure of one element of the map information in response to #CFE_SB_SEND_MAP_INFO_CC

Entry.name: MsgId
Entry.shortDescription: Message Id which has been subscribed to

Entry.name: Index
Entry.shortDescription: Routing table index where pipe destinations are found

ContainerDataType.name: SingleSubscriptionTlm_Payload
ContainerDataType.LongDescription:
This structure defines the pkt sent by SB when a subscription or a request to unsubscribe is received while subscription reporting is enabled. By default subscription reporting is disabled. This feature is intended to be used primarily by Software Bus Networking Application (SBN)
\sa #CFE_SB_ENABLE_SUB_REPORTING_CC, #CFE_SB_DISABLE_SUB_REPORTING_CC

Entry.name: SubType
Entry.shortDescription: Subscription or Unsubscription

Entry.name: MsgId
Entry.shortDescription: MsgId subscribed or unsubscribe to

Entry.name: Qos
Entry.shortDescription: Quality of Service, used only for interprocessor communication

Entry.name: Pipe
Entry.shortDescription: Destination pipe id to send above msg id

ContainerDataType.name: SubEntries
ContainerDataType.LongDescription: This structure defines an entry used in the CFE_SB_PrevSubsPkt_t Intended to be used primarily by Software Bus Networking Application (SBN) Used in structure definition #CFE_SB_PrevSubMsg_t

Entry.name: MsgId
Entry.shortDescription: MsgId portion of the subscription

Entry.name: Qos
Entry.shortDescription: Qos portion of the subscription

Entry.name: Pipe
Entry.shortDescription: PipeId portion of the subscription

ContainerDataType.name: AllSubscriptionsTlm_Payload
ContainerDataType.LongDescription: This structure defines the pkt(s) sent by SB that contains a list of all current subscriptions. This pkt is generated on cmd and intended to be used primarily by the Software Bus Networking Application (SBN). Typically, when the cmd is received there are more subscriptions than can fit in one pkt. The complete list of subscriptions is sent via a series of segmented pkts.

Entry.name: PktSegment
Entry.shortDescription: Pkt number(starts at 1) in the series

Entry.name: TotalSegments
Entry.shortDescription: Total number of pkts needed to complete the request

Entry.name: Entries
Entry.shortDescription: Number of entries in the pkt

Entry.name: Entry
Entry.shortDescription: Array of #CFE_SB_SubEntries_t entries

ContainerDataType.name: NoopCmd
ContainerDataType.shortDescription: SB task command packet command codes
ContainerDataType.LongDescription:
\cfesbcmd Software Bus No-Op
\par Description This command performs no other function than to increment the command execution counter. The command may be used to verify general aliveness of the Software Bus task. \cfecmdmnemonic \SB_NOOP
\par Command Structure #CFE_SB_CmdHdr_t
\par Command Verification Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry: - \b \c \SB_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment - The #CFE_SB_CMD0_RCVD_EID informational event message will be generated
\par Error Conditions There are no error conditions for this command. If the Software Bus receives the command, the event is sent (although it may be filtered by EVS) and the counter is incremented unconditionally.
\par Criticality None

ContainerDataType.name: ResetCountersCmd
ContainerDataType.LongDescription:
\cfesbcmd Software Bus Reset Counters
\par Description This command resets the following counters within the Software Bus housekeeping telemetry: - Command Execution Counter (\SB_CMDPC) - Command Error Counter (\SB_CMDEC) \cfecmdmnemonic \SB_ResetCounters
\par Command Structure #CFE_SB_CmdHdr_t
\par Command Verification Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry: - \b \c \SB_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment - The #CFE_SB_CMD1_RCVD_EID informational event message will be generated
\par Error Conditions There are no error conditions for this command. If the Software Bus receives the command, the event is sent (although it may be filtered by EVS) and the counter is incremented unconditionally.
\par Criticality This command is not inherently dangerous. However, it is possible for ground systems and on-board safing procedures to be designed such that they react to changes in the counter values that are reset by this command.

ContainerDataType.name: SendSbStatsCmd
ContainerDataType.LongDescription:
\cfesbcmd Send Software Bus Statistics
\par Description This command will cause the SB task to send a statistics packet containing current utilization figures and high water marks which may be useful for checking the margin of the SB platform configuration settings. \cfecmdmnemonic \SB_DUMPSTATS
\par Command Structure #CFE_SB_CmdHdr_t
\par Command Verification Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry: - \b \c \SB_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment - Receipt of statistics packet with MsgId #CFE_SB_STATS_TLM_MID - The #CFE_SB_SND_STATS_EID debug event message will be generated. All debug events are filtered by default.
\par Error Conditions There are no error conditions for this command. If the Software Bus receives the command, the debug event is sent and the counter is incremented unconditionally.
\par Criticality This command is not inherently dangerous. It will create and send a message on the software bus. If performed repeatedly, it is possible that receiver pipes may overflow. \sa

ContainerDataType.name: WriteRoutingInfoCmd
ContainerDataType.LongDescription:
\cfesbcmd Write Software Bus Routing Info to a File
\par Description This command will create a file containing the software bus routing information. The routing information contains information about every subscription that has been received through the SB subscription APIs. An absolute path and filename may be specified in the command. If this command field contains an empty string (NULL terminator as the first character) the default file path and name is used. The default file path and name is defined in the platform configuration file as #CFE_PLATFORM_SB_DEFAULT_ROUTING_FILENAME. \cfecmdmnemonic \SB_WRITEROUTING2FILE
\par Command Structure #CFE_SB_WriteFileInfoCmd_t
\par Command Verification Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry: - \b \c \SB_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment. - Specified filename created at specified location. See description. - The #CFE_SB_SND_RTG_EID debug event message will be generated. All debug events are filtered by default.
\par Error Conditions - Errors may occur during write operations to the file. Possible causes might be insufficient space in the file system or the filename or file path is improperly specified. Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry: - \b \c \SB_CMDEC - command error counter will increment - A command specific error event message is issued for all error cases. See #CFE_SB_SND_RTG_ERR1_EID and #CFE_SB_FILEWRITE_ERR_EID
\par Criticality This command is not inherently dangerous. It will create a new file in the file system and could, if performed repeatedly without sufficient file management by the operator, fill the file system.
\sa #CFE_SB_SEND_PIPE_INFO_CC, #CFE_SB_SEND_MAP_INFO_CC, #CFE_SB_WriteFileInfoCmd_t

ContainerDataType.name: EnableRouteCmd
ContainerDataType.LongDescription:
\cfesbcmd Enable Software Bus Route
\par Description This command will enable a particular destination. The destination is specified in terms of MsgID and PipeID. The MsgId and PipeID are parameters in the command. All destinations are enabled by default. This command is needed only after a #CFE_SB_DISABLE_ROUTE_CC command is used. \cfecmdmnemonic \SB_ENAROUTE
\par Command Structure #CFE_SB_EnableRouteCmd_t
\par Command Verification Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry: - \b \c \SB_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment - View routing information #CFE_SB_SEND_ROUTING_INFO_CC to verify enable/disable state change - The #CFE_SB_ENBL_RTE2_EID debug event message will be generated. All debug events are filtered by default. - Destination will begin receiving messages.
\par Error Conditions An Error may occur if the MsgId or PipeId parameters do not pass validation or the destination does not exist. Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry: - \b \c \SB_CMDEC - command error counter will increment - A command specific error event message is issued for all error cases. See #CFE_SB_ENBL_RTE1_EID or #CFE_SB_ENBL_RTE3_EID
\par Criticality This command is not inherently dangerous.
\sa #CFE_SB_SEND_ROUTING_INFO_CC, #CFE_SB_DISABLE_ROUTE_CC, #CFE_SB_EnableRouteCmd_t

ContainerDataType.name: DisableRouteCmd
ContainerDataType.LongDescription:
\cfesbcmd Disable Software Bus Route
\par Description This command will disable a particular destination. The destination is specified in terms of MsgID and PipeID. The MsgId and PipeID are parameters in the command. All destinations are enabled by default. \cfecmdmnemonic \SB_DISROUTE
\par Command Structure #CFE_SB_EnableRouteCmd_t
\par Command Verification Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry: - \b \c \SB_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment - View routing information #CFE_SB_SEND_ROUTING_INFO_CC to verify enable/disable state change - The #CFE_SB_DSBL_RTE2_EID debug event message will be generated. All debug events are filtered by default. - Destination will stop receiving messages.
\par Error Conditions An Error may occur if the MsgId or PipeId parameters do not pass validation or the destination does not exist. Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry: - \b \c \SB_CMDEC - command error counter will increment - A command specific error event message is issued for all error cases. See #CFE_SB_DSBL_RTE1_EID or #CFE_SB_DSBL_RTE3_EID
\par Criticality This command is not intended to be used in nominal conditions. It is possible to get into a state where a destination cannot be re-enabled without resetting the processor. For instance, sending this command with #CFE_SB_CMD_MID and the SB_Cmd_Pipe would inhibit any ground commanding to the software bus until the processor was reset. There are similar problems that may occur when using this command.
\sa #CFE_SB_SEND_ROUTING_INFO_CC, #CFE_SB_ENABLE_ROUTE_CC, #CFE_SB_EnableRouteCmd_t

ContainerDataType.name: WritePipeInfoCmd
ContainerDataType.LongDescription:
\cfesbcmd Write Pipe Info to a File
\par Description This command will create a file containing the software bus pipe information. The pipe information contains information about every pipe that has been created through the #CFE_SB_CreatePipe API. An absolute path and filename may be specified in the command. If this command field contains an empty string (NULL terminator as the first character) the default file path and name is used. The default file path and name is defined in the platform configuration file as #CFE_PLATFORM_SB_DEFAULT_PIPE_FILENAME. \cfecmdmnemonic \SB_WRITEPIPE2FILE
\par Command Structure #CFE_SB_WriteFileInfoCmd_t
\par Command Verification Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry: - \b \c \SB_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment. - Specified filename created at specified location. See description. - The #CFE_SB_SND_RTG_EID debug event message will be generated. All debug events are filtered by default.
\par Error Conditions - Errors may occur during write operations to the file. Possible causes might be insufficient space in the file system or the filename or file path is improperly specified. Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry: - \b \c \SB_CMDEC - command error counter will increment - A command specific error event message is issued for all error cases. See #CFE_SB_SND_RTG_ERR1_EID and #CFE_SB_FILEWRITE_ERR_EID
\par Criticality This command is not inherently dangerous. It will create a new file in the file system and could, if performed repeatedly without sufficient file management by the operator, fill the file system.
\sa #CFE_SB_SEND_ROUTING_INFO_CC, #CFE_SB_SEND_MAP_INFO_CC

ContainerDataType.name: WriteMapInfoCmd
ContainerDataType.LongDescription:
\cfesbcmd Write Map Info to a File
\par This command will create a file containing the software bus message map information. The message map is a lookup table (an array of uint16s)that allows fast access to the correct routing table element during a software bus send operation. This is diagnostic information that may be needed due to the dynamic nature of the cFE software bus. An absolute path and filename may be specified in the command. If this command field contains an empty string (NULL terminator as the first character) the default file path and name is used. The default file path and name is defined in the platform configuration file as #CFE_PLATFORM_SB_DEFAULT_MAP_FILENAME. \cfecmdmnemonic \SB_WRITEMAP2FILE
\par Command Structure #CFE_SB_WriteFileInfoCmd_t
\par Command Verification Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry: - \b \c \SB_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment. - Specified filename created at specified location. See description. - The #CFE_SB_SND_RTG_EID debug event message will be generated. All debug events are filtered by default.
\par Error Conditions - Errors may occur during write operations to the file. Possible causes might be insufficient space in the file system or the filename or file path is improperly specified. Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry: - \b \c \SB_CMDEC - command error counter will increment - A command specific error event message is issued for all error cases. See #CFE_SB_SND_RTG_ERR1_EID and #CFE_SB_FILEWRITE_ERR_EID
\par Criticality This command is not inherently dangerous. It will create a new file in the file system and could, if performed repeatedly without sufficient file management by the operator, fill the file system.
\sa #CFE_SB_SEND_ROUTING_INFO_CC, #CFE_SB_SEND_PIPE_INFO_CC

ContainerDataType.name: EnableSubReportingCmd
ContainerDataType.LongDescription:
\cfesbcmd Enable Subscription Reporting Command
\par This command will enable subscription reporting and is intended to be used only by the CFS SBN (Software Bus Networking) Application. It is not intended to be sent from the ground or used by operations. When subscription reporting is enabled, SB will generate and send a software bus packet for each subscription received. The software bus packet that is sent contains the information received in the subscription API. This subscription report is needed by SBN if offboard routing is required. \cfecmdmnemonic \SB_ENASUBRPTG
\par Command Structure #CFE_SB_CmdHdr_t
\par Command Verification Successful execution of this command will result in the sending of a packet (with the #CFE_SB_ONESUB_TLM_MID MsgId) for each subscription received by SB through the subscription APIs.
\par Error Conditions None
\par Criticality None
\sa #CFE_SB_SubRprtMsg_t, #CFE_SB_DISABLE_SUB_REPORTING_CC, #CFE_SB_SEND_PREV_SUBS_CC

ContainerDataType.name: DisableSubReportingCmd
ContainerDataType.LongDescription:
\cfesbcmd Disable Subscription Reporting Command
\par This command will disable subscription reporting and is intended to be used only by the CFS SBN (Software Bus Networking) Application. It is not intended to be sent from the ground or used by operations. When subscription reporting is enabled, SB will generate and send a software bus packet for each subscription received. The software bus packet that is sent contains the information received in the subscription API. This subscription report is needed by SBN if offboard routing is required. \cfecmdmnemonic \SB_DISSUBRPTG
\par Command Structure #CFE_SB_CmdHdr_t
\par Command Verification Successful execution of this command will result in the suppression of packets (with the #CFE_SB_ONESUB_TLM_MID MsgId) for each subscription received by SB through the subscription APIs.
\par Error Conditions None
\par Criticality None
\sa #CFE_SB_SubRprtMsg_t, #CFE_SB_ENABLE_SUB_REPORTING_CC, #CFE_SB_SEND_PREV_SUBS_CC

ContainerDataType.name: SendPrevSubsCmd
ContainerDataType.LongDescription:
\cfesbcmd Send Previous Subscriptions Command
\par This command generates a series of packets that contain information regarding all subscriptions previously received by SB. This command is intended to be used only by the CFS SBN(Software Bus Networking) Application. It is not intended to be sent from the ground or used by operations. When this command is received the software bus will generate and send a series of packets containing information about all subscription previously received. \cfecmdmnemonic \SB_SENDPREVSUBS
\par Command Structure #CFE_SB_CmdHdr_t
\par Command Verification Successful execution of this command will result in a series of packets (with the #CFE_SB_ALLSUBS_TLM_MID MsgId) being sent on the software bus.
\par Error Conditions None
\par Criticality None
\sa #CFE_SB_PrevSubMsg_t, #CFE_SB_ENABLE_SUB_REPORTING_CC, #CFE_SB_DISABLE_SUB_REPORTING_CC

Interface.name: SoftwareBusRouting
Interface.shortDescription: CFE software bus low-level message transfer service
Interface.LongDescription: Basic message routing service over the CFE software bus. Messages are routed based on the Application ID field within the CCSDS SpacePacket primary header. All traffic on this interface must use the SpacePacket as its base type, and this interface operates solely at the CCSDS spacepacket level and does not interpret message content.

Interface.name: SoftwareBusAccess
Interface.LongDescription: This represents the access interface used for passing message datagrams to and from the message transfer service (MTS). It operates using publish/subscribe semantics, where messages are sent and received using an abstract identifier referred to as a software bus message ID. This essentially acts as a filter on the underlying MTS interface, where outgoing traffic is "tagged" with the appropriate MsgId and only the specified MsgId passes through on the receive side.

Interface.name: Telemetry
Interface.shortDescription: CFE software bus pipe publication interface
Interface.LongDescription: Higher level interface to publish a message via the CFE software bus. cFS applications may define their own application-specific interface of this type to indicate the message(s) it will publish via the software bus. This is typically the various types of telemetry that the application generates.

Parameter.name: InstanceNumber
Parameter.shortDescription: Identifies a specific instance of this topic within the mission

Parameter.name: TopicId
Parameter.shortDescription: Abstract topic ID number shared by all instances

Command.name: indication
Command.shortDescription: Publishes a single datagram on the CFE software bus (SB)

Interface.name: Telecommand
Interface.shortDescription: CFE software bus pipe listener interface
Interface.LongDescription:
Interface to listen for a message from the CFE software bus. cFS application data sheets may derive their own application-specific interface from this base to indicate the type of message(s) it will subscribe to via the software bus. This is typically the various telecommand messages that the application supports.
This is a receive-only interface; the Telemetry interface provides the equivalent send function.

Parameter.name: InstanceNumber
Parameter.shortDescription: Identifies a specific instance of this topic within the mission

Parameter.name: TopicId
Parameter.shortDescription: Abstract topic ID number shared by all instances

Command.name: indication
Command.shortDescription: Indicates a single command on the CFE software bus (SB)

Interface.name: ALLSUBS_TLM
Interface.shortDescription: Software bus global subscription telemetry interface

Interface.name: ONESUB_TLM
Interface.shortDescription: Software bus single subscription telemetry interface
